SENT.plain: Two successful cases underwent simultaneous repair for funnel chest using sternal turnover with rectus abdominal flap and intracardiac lesions were reported
A 7-year-old female (case 1) was diagnosed with funnel chest and annulo-aortic ectasia due to Marfan's syndrome
Second patient was a 12-year-old male (case 2) with funnel chest and ventricular septal defect (VSD)
Both patients underwent sternal turnover and intracardiac repair (case 1: Bentall's operation, case 2: patch closure of VSD), simultaneously
Removing the cost-sterno complex before cardiac operation allowed an excellent surgical exposure
Bleeding was minimum, especially no homologous blood transfusion was needed in case 2
Simultaneous surgery consisted of intracardiac repair and sternal turnover is recommended even for pediatric patients
